document.heading: District Government Family Bereavement Leave Second Temporary Amendment Act of 2022

To amend, on a temporary basis, the District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978 to provide paid leave for a District government employee when the employee suffers the death of the employee's minor child or a stillbirth.
document.text: BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District Government Family Bereavement Leave Second Temporary Amendment Act of 2022".

section.text: Section 1203 of the District of Columbia Government Comprehensive Merit Personnel Act of 1978, effective March 3, 1979 (D.C. Law 2-139; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-612.03), is amended by adding a new subsection (n-1) to read as follows:

para.text: In addition to the leave authorized by subsection (n) of this section, an employee shall be entitled to 10 days of bereavement leave without loss of pay, leave, or service credit when the employee suffers a stillbirth or the employee suffers the death of the employee's child under the age of 21 years.
Leave authorized by paragraph (1) of this subsection must be exercised within 60 days after the death of the employee's child or after the employee suffers a stillbirth.

Leave authorized by paragraph (1) of this subsection shall not count toward the unpaid medical and family leave entitlements in the District of Columbia Family and Medical Leave Act of 1990, effective October 3, 1990 (D.C. Law 8-181; D.C. Official Code ยง 32-501 et seq.), and shall be in addition to paid medical or family leave otherwise available to the employee under this title.
For the purposes of this subsection, the term:
The biological, adoptive, or step-child of the employee or the employee's spouse; or
A person for whom the employee stands in loco parentis.
"Stillbirth" means the death of a fetus at 20 weeks' gestation or later for the following employees:
An employee who was pregnant with the fetus;
An employee who is the spouse or domestic partner of the individual who was pregnant with the fetus; or
An employee who intended to assume parental responsibilities for the fetus had the fetus been born alive.

section.heading: Fiscal impact statement.
section.text: The Council adopts the fiscal impact statement of the Budget Director as the fiscal impact statement required by section 4a of the General Legislative Procedures Act of 1975, approved October 16, 2006 (120 Stat. 2038; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-301.47a).

para.text: This act shall take effect following the approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council to override the veto), a 30-day period of congressional review as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Home Rule Act, approved December 24, 1973 (87 Stat. 813; D.C. Official Code ยง 1-206.02(c)(1)), and publication in the District of Columbia Register.
This act shall expire after 225 days of its having taken effect.
